hanzi-su-wiki:
隣

Значения

Примыкать, прилегать, находиться рядом; соседний; соседи

Мнемоника

Погребенные у стены 阝 разбойники 舛, враждовавшие при жизни. На могиле блуждают синеватые огоньки, похожие на зерна риса 米.

Варианты

邻, 鄰

lín
Japanese variant of 鄰 |邻
Японский вариант соседа | соседа
rtega_mnemonic:
鄰鄰RS
邻邻		隣隣厸neighbour, neighbouring, adjacent
  • flickering lights 粦 of neighbours in the city or on the hill 阝
heisig_constituent: neighbouring, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, shoeshine, rice, sunglasses, dancing legs, ballerina, evening
koohiiStory1: America thinks it is the pinnacle of the world, looking down on all neighboring countries through its mirrored, aviator sunglasses.
koohiiStory2: All the neighboring communities to the Pinnacle have a major problem. The kids at the Pinnacle have a habit of throwing down rice from the city walls in all directions, so people in neighboring communities are forced to wear sunglasses all the time in order to avoid getting rice in their eyes.
jp_example_words: 隣(となり): next to, next door to
jp_readingExamples: 隣る (とな.る), 隣 (となり)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Inside that building someone is doing a rice dance. That someone is your neighbor.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine your neighbor doing a rice dance, whatever that may be, in the building next to yours. That's your neighbor, for ya.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your neighbor has an incredible ring (りん) that they use for their rice dance.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the ring your neighbor has as overly extravagant. You have to make it wild enough for you to remember. Maybe it is integral to their rice dance. Perhaps you covet your neighbor's rice dance ring.
Ru_Radicals: 夕 (вечер), 阡, 米 (рис), 舛 (танцующие ноги)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the rice you oppose (粦) is on the hill (⻖) next door

隣字的基本解释

隣
lín
同“邻”。

隣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lín］
［《廣韻》力珍切，平真，來。］
“厸1”的今字。亦作“吅2”。“邻1”的繁体字。亦作“隣1”。
(1)古代行政单位。（1）五家为邻。《周礼·地官·遂人》：“五家爲鄰，五鄰爲里。”《汉书·食货志上》：“五家爲鄰，五鄰爲里。”（2）八家为邻。《尚书大传》卷四：“古者處師，八家爲鄰，三鄰而爲朋。”《韩诗外传》卷四：“八家爲鄰，家得百畝。”《晋书·地理志上》：“昔在帝堯，叶和萬邦，制八家爲鄰，三鄰爲朋。”（3）四家为邻。宋李上交《近事会元·乡里邻保坊村》：“唐高祖武德七年令云，百户爲里，五里爲鄉，四家爲鄰，五家爲保。”《旧唐书·职官志二》：“四家爲鄰，五鄰爲保。”
(2)古代行政单位。八家为邻。
(3)古代行政单位。四家为邻。
(4)指邻居；邻国；邻境。
(5)古称君主的近臣。
(6)指亲近的人。
(7)亲密，亲近。
(8)靠近；连接。
(9)界畔。
(10)近似；相仿。
(11)坚实，紧密。
(12)见“鄰菌”。
(13)通“燐”。燐火。
(14)通“磷”。
(15)姓。<

隣字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【阜字部】　隣； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1360第22
【廣韻】俗鄰字。

暂无。

adjacent
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lín］
["Guang Yun", cherish and cut it, plain, come. ]
The present character of "厸1". Also known as "吅2". Traditional Chinese characters for "side 1". Also known as "neighbor 1".
(1) Ancient administrative unit. (1) Five families are neighbors. "Zhou Li·Diguan·Suiren": "Five families are neighbors, and five neighbors are neighbors." "Han Shu·Shihuo Zhi 1": "Five families are neighbors, and five neighbors are neighbors." (2) Eight families For neighbors. "Shangshu Dazhuan" Volume 4: "The ancients are masters, the eight families are neighbors, and the three neighbors are friends." "Han Shiwaizhuan" Volume 4: "Eight families are neighbors, and the family has a hundred acres." "Book of Jin. "First Geography": "In the past in Emperor Yao, Ye He Wanbang, made eight neighbors, and three neighbors as friends." (3) Four neighbors. Song Li handed in "Xinshihuiyuan·Xiangli Linbaofang Village": "Tang Gaozu's martial arts in seven years led the cloud, hundreds of households are li, five li is the township, four are neighbors, and five are guarantors." "Old Tang Book · Official Records II": "Four families are neighbors, and five neighbors are guarantee."
(2) Ancient administrative unit. Eight families are neighbors.
(3) Ancient administrative units. The four are neighbors.
(4) Refers to neighbors; neighboring countries; neighboring borders.
(5) The close minister of the monarch in ancient times.
(6) Refers to a close person.
(7) Closeness and closeness.
(8) Close to; connect.
(9) Boundary side.
(10) Approximate; similar.
(11) Solid and tight.
(12) See "Neighboring Bacteria".
(13) Through "燐". Burning fire.
(14) Through "phosphorus".
(15) Last name.

lín
вм. 邻
Radicals: 阝, 米, 舛  (building, rice, dance)
Meaning Mnemonic
Inside that building someone is doing a rice dance. That someone is your neighbor.
Imagine your neighbor doing a rice dance, whatever that may be, in the building next to yours. That's your neighbor, for ya.
Reading Mnemonic
Your neighbor has an incredible ring (りん) that they use for their rice dance.
Imagine the ring your neighbor has as overly extravagant. You have to make it wild enough for you to remember. Maybe it is integral to their rice dance. Perhaps you covet your neighbor's rice dance ring.
